content.question: If <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> reacts with chlorine to form <math alttext="N a C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following elements reacts with <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to form an ionic compound in a one-to-one ratio, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is in the same group as <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="M g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because its mass is similar to that of <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="A r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because its mass is similar to that of <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has the same number of valence electrons as <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has the same number of valence electrons as <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
